Party Function Description: The original supplier of the goods.
Party to which goods are consigned.

Party Function Name: Freight payer on behalf of the consignor.
Party Function Description: Freight payer is a third party acting on behalf of the consignor.

Party Function Name: Freight payer on behalf of the consignee.
Party Function Description: Freight payer is a third party acting on behalf of the consignee.
Issuer of a document and/or sender of a message.
The first party which is to be notified.
The second party which is to be notified.
Party to be notified of arrival of goods.
Identification of freight forwarder giving services to the consignor (shipper).
Identification of freight forwarder giving services to the consignee.

The activity of discharging, shifting, loading, and lashing containers (both full and empty) as well as other cargo from/to a vessel during port stay. Normally quantified with a move-count and a number of moves per hour.

A floating, sea going structure (mother vessels and feeder vessels) with either an internal or external mode of propulsion designed for the transport of cargo and/or passengers. Ocean vessels are uniquely identified by an IMO number consisting of 7 digits, or alternatively by their AIS signal with an MMSI number
The activity of conducting a vessel within restricted waters.
The party offering the towage services.
The party offering the lashing services.
The party offering the bunkering services.
A facility for loading, moving or discharging containers. Terminals can be both inland terminals for trucks and rail or port terminals are accessed by vessels and these can contain multiple berths.
The party signing the service contract with the carrier.
Party acting as a booking office for transport and forwarding services.
The carrier office responsible for processing the booking.
"The party offering the mooring services."
"The party offering the Slugde services."
Any other service not covered by a more specific code.
Party to whom the title to the goods is transferred by means of endorsement.
Party responsible for the declaration of the verified gross mass of a packed container under SOLAS
